channel.title: Caffeine vs ritalin
channel.description:
I'm serious, please compare these substances, harm, benefits, side effects.
Such as alcohol vs caffeine
Alcohol is an intoxicant, stimulant, depressant, possible euphoria
Weed stimulant/muscle relaxant, sleep aid, a wide variety of positive and possible negative effects, though mostly positive with proper usage.
such as anti-depressant like effects (Mood changes, induces euphoria, laughter, etc) Pain relief Nausea relief
tobacco stimulant, hunger suppressant, euphoria, very high addictive potential -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Ritalin and caffeine are both stimulants they both release dopamine and epinephrine Increased heart rate, weight loss, act on the cns, euphoria, etc

item.title: Caffeine vs ritalin
item.dc:creator: @Techkid Techkid
item.description:
@Techkid wrote:

[quote=“Demnish, post:1, topic:524498”]I’m serious, please compare these substances, harm, benefits, side effects.

Such as alcohol vs caffeine

Alcohol is an intoxicant, stimulant, depressant, possible euphoria

Weed stimulant/muscle relaxant, sleep aid, a wide variety of positive and possible negative effects, though mostly positive with proper usage.

such as
anti-depressant like effects (Mood changes, induces euphoria, laughter, etc)
Pain relief
Nausea relief

tobacco stimulant, hunger suppressant, euphoria, very high addictive potential

Ritalin and caffeine are both stimulants they both release dopamine and epinephrine
Increased heart rate, weight loss, act on the cns, euphoria, etc[/quote]
Both are bad for you and are addictions that waste money and time… Just think about all the money people could have saved if they didn’t have addictions! Man everyone would be rich!

Read full topic

item.title: Caffeine vs ritalin
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Skyro, post:4, topic:524498”]I’m a heavy Coffee Drinker, and I’m also Prescribed Ritalin because of my ADHD. Coffee doesn’t make you loose weight, It may speed up your actions and such but it actually doesn’t make you loose weight. Only the raw Green Coffee Bean can make you loose weight nor does coffee release a Euphoria. Ritalin I’m on 30mg/Day and It doesn’t really increase my heart rate though it does make you ‘loose weight’ in a way since it will stop you from eating and make you not hungry. As for Euphoria, If injested in a way (Snorted, Injected) then yes it would give you one.[/quote]Caffeine is supposed to help suppress hunger.

Do you feel better when you’re on Ritalin? How noticable of a difference is it when you’re on/off? I wish they’d stop poisoning childrens ability to be creative in their own way.

If you’re doing any of these recreationally, stop. There’s nothing in it for anyone.

[quote=“Mikey Sasse, post:22, topic:524498”]Caffeine will make you sick if you overdose on it, but Adderall will only make you sick if you eat, or take WAY too much.[/quote]Are you familiar with what “WAY too much” means? Overdose, yeah.

Adderall is also an amphetamine.

Read full topic

item.title: Caffeine vs ritalin
item.dc:creator: @Mikey_Sasse Mikey Sasse
item.description:
@Mikey_Sasse wrote:

Those two are similar to an extent. I’m not really sure about Ritalin, but SWIM has taken Adderall on many occasions (as much as 150mg at one time). The difference between the two can be pretty staggering. Caffeine will make you sick if you overdose on it, but Adderall will only make you sick if you eat, or take WAY too much. The effect is pretty similar to speed in high doses (increased heart rate, stimulated creativity, euphoria, over-active bladder, dry mouth, decreased (or no) appetite). In small doses it will definitely help anyone with ADD. SWIM highly recommends it for anyone that wants to obsess on something for 10+ hours, or is sleep deprived.

Read full topic

item.title: Caffeine vs ritalin
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

I drink green tea all day, I don’t know how much caffiene is in that but I assume it’d be fairly comparative to coffee. I use use a caffeine pill (200mg caffeine hydronous) about 20-30 minutes before I exercise (I exercise in a fasted state, aswell, so the effects would be a lot stronger) and I feel euphoric, have a lot more endurance, I drop so much water weight it’s not funny (piss like a racehorse).

I’ve never taken Ritalin so I can’t comment on that.

Read full topic

item.title: Caffeine vs ritalin
item.dc:creator: @Demnish Demnish
item.description:
@Demnish wrote:

lol you guys are funny

Skyro:

I’m a heavy Coffee Drinker, and I’m also Prescribed Ritalin because of my ADHD. Coffee doesn’t make you loose weight, It may speed up your actions and such but it actually doesn’t make you loose weight. Only the raw Green Coffee Bean can make you loose weight nor does coffee release a Euphoria. Ritalin I’m on 30mg/Day and It doesn’t really increase my heart rate though it does make you ‘loose weight’ in a way since it will stop you from eating and make you not hungry. As for Euphoria, If injested in a way (Snorted, Injected) then yes it would give you one.

I, myself are a big coffee drinker, SWIM takes Ritalin, finds it has an afterglow with alleviates adhd symptons (Real, cannot work, concentrate, easily distracted, seems ok until the notes show up, etc) never real been diagnosed with adhd, lol, SWIM finds caffeine aids in weight loss, as it is a diuretic (could help with bloat, water retention, as it does with me), and a natural laxative I believe, I thought it might of been just coffee that’s a laxative, but caffeine works wonders for me, about 200mg of caffeine, i get the best bowel movements, so refreshing (water does help effects to an extent, water is easier to drink in larger when using caffeine, for these reasons, diuretic, laxative, etc) and it reduces my appetite, thus reducing my caloric intake resulting in noticeable weight loss and obviously leaner mass if used for an extended period of time (a week), i might be caffeine sensitive but i notice i euphoria, laughter, sense of wellbeing when taking caffeine comparable to Ritalin, Alcohol (Very good comparison against alcohol) and marijuana, Movitation increases and energy boost is obvious, heart rate may or may not significantly elevate, does not alleviate ADHD symptoms, may mildly positively affect the symptoms as i noticed, comparable to a low dose of Ritalin, but SWIM discovered Ritalin was almost a magic bullet to adhd symptons and offered a alternative to caffeine in substantial lower dosage, without the constant feeling of needing to use the bathroom/bowel movents/peeing with the medicinal dose of caffeine for my body, i was never diagnosed with adhd, but i symptoms for a while (easily distracted, hard to focus, hyperactive, not getting work done, really hard to explain, sometimes comparable to a dream) but medication with caffeine, cannabis, Ritalin, and through trail and error alcohol but never mixing the substances has helped me become more normal than i would normally be.

SWIM has smoked a cigar of dried, cured, fruity, sour taste nicotiana rustica that resulted in a cannabis like experience
for about 4 hours, no anxiety whatsoever, memory improved (all noticeable) reduced appetite, and felt strangely normal (sedated), calm and friendly
relaxed, euphoric, easy to laugh, more energy than normal even while i was fasting for a day.

Read full topic

item.title: Caffeine vs ritalin
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Soulcist, post:16, topic:524498”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=643049.msg4330297#msg4330297 date=1373561629]
I would go with “tolerance” more then immune, if you’re still being affected by caffeine then you’re not really immune to it.
[/quote]
I suppose so… but I caffeine doesn’t affect me at all whatsoever. Drinking a monster wouldn’t do a single thing to me as well as coffee (big drinker on coffee) or other high amounts of caffeinated drinks.[/quote]

Since you’re a big drinking of coffee you have build up a higher tolerance meaning you will most likely see minimal effects while drinking it, but once you cut that caffeine intake lets see how well you hold up.

EDIT: I should add in you could have an immunity to caffeine, anything can happen in the word of chemical reactions?

Read full topic

item.title: Caffeine vs ritalin
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Soulcist, post:14, topic:524498”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=643049.msg4330283#msg4330283 date=1373560637]

Surely abuse of anything is bad? You’d probably die of abusing facking salad mate.

This made me lol.

OT: I’ve never had to be on Ritalin but I’ve been drinking coffee since I was little. Isn’t it possible to be immune to caffeine in terms of keeping someone awake, hyper, or that slight energy boost? If it is - I am.

yes caffeine can effect a person differently then others, in some it will keep them more relaxed and others it will make them go crazy.
[/quote]
Then I am “immune” to it then (I should have assumed this…).[/quote]

I would go with “tolerance” more then immune, if you’re still being affected by caffeine then you’re not really immune to it.

Read full topic

item.title: Caffeine vs ritalin
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Skyro, post:8, topic:524498”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=643049.msg4330070#msg4330070 date=1373516394]

Nothing annoys me more than kids going out and taking Ritalin to get ‘high’.
I’m ADHD and it just shits me how ignorant these individuals are.
[/quote]Snorting ritz is the shit. What’s wrong with it? Everyone I know who has ADHD abuses Ritalin.

That will actually make their ADHD worse.

It actually doesn’t make it worse, because it has a completely different effects on our brain. To someone without ADHD.[/quote]
I don’t mean permanently, I mean short-term. If you abuse ritalin (and I don’t mean slight overdoses) it will actually reverse its own effects and make you lose focus.

Read full topic
